GET /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets.description: Lists all R2 buckets on your account

schema.description: Bucket names to filter by. Only buckets with this phrase in their name will be returned.
Bucket name to start searching after. Buckets are ordered lexicographically.
Maximum number of buckets to return in a single call
Pagination cursor received during the last List Buckets call. R2 buckets are paginated using cursors instead of page numbers.
Lists buckets in the provided jurisdiction

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

cursor.description: A continuation token that should be used to fetch the next page of results

per_page.description: Maximum number of results on this page

storage_class.description: Storage class for newly uploaded objects, unless specified otherwise.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/r2/buckets/{.description: Register a new custom domain for an existing R2 bucket.

enabled.description: Whether to enable public bucket access at the custom domain. If undefined, the domain will be enabled.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/r2/temp-acce.description: Creates temporary access credentials on a bucket that can be optionally scoped to prefixes or objects.

objects.description: Optional object paths to scope the credentials to

parentAccessKeyId.description: The parent access key id to use for signing

prefixes.description: Optional prefix paths to scope the credentials to

ttlSeconds.description: How long the credentials will live for in seconds

destination.description: R2 bucket to copy objects to

accessKeyId.description:
ID of a Cloudflare API token.
This is the value labelled "Access Key ID" when creating an API
token from the [R2 dashboard](https://dash.cloudflare.com/?to=/:account/r2/api-tokens).

Sippy will use this token when writing objects to R2, so it is
best to scope this token to the bucket you're enabling Sippy for.

secretAccessKey.description:
Value of a Cloudflare API token.
This is the value labelled "Secret Access Key" when creating an API
token from the [R2 dashboard](https://dash.cloudflare.com/?to=/:account/r2/api-tokens).

Sippy will use this token when writing objects to R2, so it is
best to scope this token to the bucket you're enabling Sippy for.

source.description: AWS S3 bucket to copy objects from

accessKeyId.description: Access Key ID of an IAM credential (ideally scoped to a single S3 bucket)

bucket.description: Name of the AWS S3 bucket

region.description: Name of the AWS availability zone

secretAccessKey.description: Secret Access Key of an IAM credential (ideally scoped to a single S3 bucket)

destination.description: R2 bucket to copy objects to

accessKeyId.description:
ID of a Cloudflare API token.
This is the value labelled "Access Key ID" when creating an API
token from the [R2 dashboard](https://dash.cloudflare.com/?to=/:account/r2/api-tokens).

Sippy will use this token when writing objects to R2, so it is
best to scope this token to the bucket you're enabling Sippy for.

secretAccessKey.description:
Value of a Cloudflare API token.
This is the value labelled "Secret Access Key" when creating an API
token from the [R2 dashboard](https://dash.cloudflare.com/?to=/:account/r2/api-tokens).

Sippy will use this token when writing objects to R2, so it is
best to scope this token to the bucket you're enabling Sippy for.

source.description: GCS bucket to copy objects from

clientEmail.description: Client email of an IAM credential (ideally scoped to a single GCS bucket)

privateKey.description: Private Key of an IAM credential (ideally scoped to a single GCS bucket)

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

destination.description: Details about the configured destination bucket

accessKeyId.description:
ID of the Cloudflare API token used when writing objects to this
bucket
